comments: Good first impression. Class started out slow and vague, but really picked up and became much more clear. Not a demanding professor and does whatever he can to make life easy for his students. Easy grader; open notebook tests. I hate philosophy but enjoyed his class a decent amount. Great, unique guy

By far one of the best professors at Stony Brook. He really tries to help all the students, even those not making an effort. Every class is worthwhile.He gets you to see your world from a different point of view. Just put in the effort and you should do fine in this class. He also posts his own class notes on blackboard. Would definitely recommend.
he is a very wise man! 3 quiz, 3 essay and an easy A or B,C if you snooze!
I really like this class! A really nice intro class for philosophy! He\'s really nice. Just do the reading, go to class, pay attention and you\'ll do great!

A great guy whose only desire is to get you to see things from a different point of view. Very interesting and thought provoking professor. 3 essays and quizzes. He\'s a really fair grader and cares about his students. Sometimes what he has to say can go over your head, but with patience you\'ll realize how great he is.
Great Guy! Interesting readings... Fair grader... Very interactive... Reachable... Learned a lot... Would deff recommend

Guy looks just as you\'d expect a professor to look, and acts accordingly. If you are a fan of Alan Watts philosophies, this class is dynamite. All tests are open book(4) and most class discussions are very interesting. If you\'re a fan of Buddhism and its philosophy, you\'re in a good place
